title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 10
author: Various
snippet: While residing at the Castle of Crail, the king and his younger noblesresolved on partaking of the wild sports of the neighbourhood; and withthis view they proceeded one day, well mounted, and attended by thehounds, to Kingsbarns, a fine tract of land belonging to the crown,where the grain was stored in barns for payment of the king's rents; andfrom thence they passed on to an extensive and thickly-woodeddistrict--in fact, a large forest, which now constitutes a considerableportion of the Parish of St Andrews and surrounding parishes.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 10
author: Various
snippet: While residing at the Castle of Crail, the king and his younger noblesresolved on partaking of the wild sports of the neighbourhood; and withthis view they proceeded one day, well mounted, and attended by thehounds, to Kingsbarns, a fine tract of land belonging to the crown,where the grain was stored in barns for payment of the king's rents; andfrom thence they passed on to an extensive and thickly-woodeddistrict--in fact, a large forest, which now constitutes a considerableportion of the Parish of St Andrews and surrounding parishes.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: Thencam the sough, as pleasant to the ears o' Kingsbarns as the whistlin'winds to the outlaying bluegowns, that his victim was burned.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: Yet _he_ tried to save his body by fleeing to France--vainflight, for his persecutor, Kingsbarns, wrote incontinent to theauthorities at Bordeaux, to watch him as an enemy to the holy kirk.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 07
author: Various
snippet: Heard ye that GilbertBlackburn o' Kingsbarns, the commendator o' Pittenweem, is shortly totak up his residence here, whar, methinks, he has as little right as thepuir beadsman."
